strDesc: [us] inquires about visas for K-Leg, 1036-Ganymed
strTooltip: Browse and purchase visa application materials for Nnamdi Azikiwe Station/K-Leg, 1036-Ganymed.

strDesc: [us] inquires about visas for K-Leg, 1036-Ganymed
strTooltip: Browse and purchase visa application materials for Nnamdi Azikiwe Station/K-Leg, 1036-Ganymed.

strDesc:
Most sovereignties in the System observe a tiered immigration status, or "strata." Usually ranging from undocumented (illegal) immigrant, up to full citizenship, a person's strata dictates which rights they enjoy with the sovereignty.

Rights can include access to certain areas or services, trade authorization, or even legal protections or permissions.

Such rights are usually conferred by parents through birth (jus sanguinis), and in some cases, by being born in the territory (jus soli).

Obtaining legal status after birth usually involves applying for a visa, and may include getting a sponsor and/or paying a significant fee.

Nnamdi Azikiwe Station/K-Leg offers no legal citizenship, only corporate-sponsored Permanent Residence. Unlike many sovereignties, K-Leg immigration pathways conspicuously lack sponsorship programs (except perhaps to those favored by Harbourmaster Adeyemi personally).

Cost: $5,000,000

K-Leg's Gold-tier Investor Class Visa Program targets immigrant entrepreneurs with the skills and potential to build businesses in K-Leg that are innovative, can create profits for the corporation, jobs for K-Leg laborers, and can compete on a System-wide scale.

Do you have an innovative business idea, and the means to grow your business? If you can prove your ability to contribute to the advancement of Nnamdi Azikiwe Station/K-Leg, you may be able to immigrate with this visa class.

POSTED: UNFORTUNATELY, THE NNAMDI AZIKIWE IMMIGRATION BUREAU IS OVERRUN WITH LOCAL APPLICANTS AT THIS TIME, WITH AN AVERAGE 2 YEAR WAITING PERIOD. THIS KIOSK IS NO LONGER ACCEPTING NEW PERMANENT RESIDENCE APPLICATIONS.

Those seeking K-Leg Residency should go to Venus. Venus's OKLG embassy is still accepting applicants.

strTitle: Not Accepting Local Applicants (Try Venus Embassies)
strDesc:
POSTED: UNFORTUNATELY, THE NNAMDI AZIKIWE IMMIGRATION BUREAU IS OVERRUN WITH LOCAL APPLICANTS AT THIS TIME, WITH AN AVERAGE 2 YEAR WAITING PERIOD. THIS KIOSK IS NO LONGER ACCEPTING NEW PERMANENT RESIDENCE APPLICATIONS.

Those seeking K-Leg Residency should go to Venus. Venus's OKLG embassy is still accepting applicants.

Cost: $750,000

The Skilled Laborer (SL) program is one of Nnamdi Azikiwe Station/K-Leg's Premier Shipyard Revitalization (PSR) initiatives for attracting and processing suitable immigration applications. The SL program allows candidates with foreign work experience and no connections to K-Leg to apply for permanent residency.

In order to qualify for SL, a candidate must have work experience in one of the following in-demand skills:

-Spaceship Engineering
-Construction
-Civil Engineering
-Administration

Those meeting the skill requirements with sufficient funds have an option to purchase this status.

POSTED: UNFORTUNATELY, THE NNAMDI AZIKIWE IMMIGRATION BUREAU IS OVERRUN WITH LOCAL APPLICANTS AT THIS TIME, WITH AN AVERAGE 2 YEAR WAITING PERIOD. THIS KIOSK IS NO LONGER ACCEPTING NEW PERMANENT RESIDENCE APPLICATIONS.

Those seeking K-Leg Residency should go to Venus. Venus's OKLG embassy is still accepting applicants.

Most sovereignties in the System observe a tiered immigration status, or "strata." Usually ranging from undocumented (illegal) immigrant, up to full citizenship, a person's strata dictates which rights they enjoy with the sovereignty.

Rights can include access to certain areas or services, trade authorization, or even legal protections or permissions.

Such rights are usually conferred by parents through birth (jus sanguinis), and in some cases, by being born in the territory (jus soli).

Obtaining legal status after birth usually involves applying for a visa, and may include getting a sponsor and/or paying a significant fee.

Nnamdi Azikiwe Station/K-Leg offers no legal citizenship, only corporate-sponsored Permanent Residence. Unlike many sovereignties, K-Leg immigration pathways conspicuously lack sponsorship programs (except perhaps to those favored by Harbourmaster Adeyemi personally).

Cost: $5,000,000

K-Leg's Gold-tier Investor Class Visa Program targets immigrant entrepreneurs with the skills and potential to build businesses in Nnamdi Azikiwe Station/K-Leg that are innovative, can create profits for the corporation, jobs for K-Leg laborers, and can compete on a System-wide scale.

Do you have an innovative business idea, and the means to grow your business? If you can prove your ability to contribute to the advancement of Nnamdi Azikiwe Station/K-Leg, you may be able to immigrate with this visa class.

After submitting your application fee, your information is vetted through a cursory background check. Nnamdi Azikiwe Immigration Bureau could still discover a problem with your application during its full investigation, but at least the preliminary check passes.

Congratulations! You are now the proud holder of Permanent Resident status on Nnamdi Azikiwe Station/K-Leg!

Go enjoy the trade discounts and private housing opportunities.

Cost: $750,000

The Skilled Laborer (SL) program is one of Nnamdi Azikiwe Station/K-Leg's Premier Shipyard Revitalization (PSR) initiatives for attracting and processing suitable immigration applications. The SL program allows candidates with foreign work experience and no connections to K-Leg to apply for permanent residency.

In order to qualify for SL, a candidate must have work experience in one of the following in-demand skills:

-Spaceship Engineering
-Construction
-Civil Engineering
-Administration

Those meeting the skill requirements with sufficient funds have an option to purchase this status.

strTitle: Pay for Skilled Labor OKLG visa
strDesc:
After submitting your application fee, your information is vetted through a cursory background check. Nnamdi Azikiwe Immigration Bureau assesses your proficiency in the desired skillsets with a battery of tests.

Congratulations! You are now the proud holder of Permanent Resident status on Nnamdi Azikiwe Station/K-Leg!

Go enjoy the trade discounts and private housing opportunities.

Visa application services are only relevant to those who do not already have legal status at Nnamdi Azikiwe Station/K-Leg.

As a permanent resident of K-Leg, you do not need this service.

strTitle: Inquire about Visas for Encantado, Venus
strTooltip: Browse and purchase visa application materials for Encantado Aerostat, Venus.

strTitle: Inquire about Visas for Encantado, Venus
strTooltip: Browse and purchase visa application materials for Encantado Aerostat, Venus.

strDesc:
Most sovereignties in the System observe a tiered immigration status, or "strata." Usually ranging from undocumented (illegal) immigrant, up to full citizenship, a person's strata dictates which rights they enjoy with the sovereignty.

Rights can include access to certain areas or services, eligibility for private housing or ship docking, enhanced prices on trade authorization, or even legal protections or permissions.

Such rights are usually conferred by parents through birth (jus sanguinis), and in some cases, by being born in the territory (jus soli).

Obtaining legal status after birth usually involves applying for a visa, and may include getting a sponsor and/or paying a significant fee.

Cost: $5,000,000

Encantado's Investor Class Visa Program targets immigrant entrepreneurs with the skills and potential to build businesses in Encantado that are innovative, can create jobs for Encantense, and can compete on a System-wide scale.

Do you have an innovative business idea, and the means to grow your business? If you can prove your ability to contribute to the advancement of Encantado, you may be able to immigrate with this visa class.

After submitting your application fee, your information is vetted through a cursory background check. Encantado Immigration Public Services could still discover a problem with your application during its full investigation, but at least the preliminary check passes.

Congratulations! You are now the proud holder of Permanent Resident status on Encantado!

Go enjoy the trade discounts and private housing opportunities.

Cost: $750,000

The Skilled Laborer (SL) program is one of Encantado's Express Entry (3E) systems for processing immigration applications. The SL program allows candidates with foreign work experience and no connections to Encantado to apply for permanent residency.

In order to qualify for SL, a candidate must have work experience in one of the following in-demand skills:

-Construction
-Civil Engineering
-Electrical Engineering

Those meeting the skill requirements with sufficient funds have an option to purchase this status.

strTitle: Pay for Skilled Labor VENC visa
strDesc:
After submitting your application fee, your information is vetted through a cursory background check. Encantado Immigration Public Services assesses your proficiency in the desired skillsets with a battery of tests.

Congratulations! You are now the proud holder of Permanent Resident status on Encantado!

Go enjoy the trade discounts and private housing opportunities.

Cost: $1,000,000

Local authorities can also lend a hand at sponsoring immigrants via the Joint Local Authorities Program (JLAP), where local authority organizations partner with the Government of Encantado to sponsor immigrants that fit an acceptable citizenry profile.

(Requires a local authority officer to agree to sponsor applicant first.)

After submitting your application fee, and the requisite interview of your local authority sponsor, you are deemed an acceptable profile for admittance to JLAP.

Congratulations! You are now the proud holder of Permanent Resident status on Encantado!

Go enjoy the trade discounts and private housing opportunities.

Cost: $500,000

The Family Sponsorship Program (FSP) in Encantado is a component of Encantado's immigration system, enabling Entantense citizens and permanent residents to sponsor their spouses, family, or trusted friends for permanent residency in Encantado. The program aims to facilitate family reunification by allowing Entantense citizens or permanent residents to bring their loved ones to live with them in Encantado.

(Requires an Encantado resident to agree to sponsor applicant first.)

After submitting your application fee, a background check, and the requisite interview of your sponsor, you are deemed an acceptable profile for admittance to FSP.

Congratulations! You are now the proud holder of Permanent Resident status on Encantado!

Go enjoy the trade discounts and private housing opportunities.

Visa application services are only relevant to those who do not already have legal status at Encantado.

As a citizen of Encantado, you do not need this service.

Visa application services are only relevant to those who do not already have legal status at Encantado.

As a permanent resident of Encantado, you do not need this service.
You resume playing.

After submitting your application fee, your information is vetted through a cursory background check. Newcal Immigration Public Services assesses your proficiency in the desired skillsets with a battery of tests.

strDesc: [us] asks on which offworld location [them] is looking to legally exist.
[us] asks [them] about illicitly procured visa opportunities for Permanent Resident status at Nnamdi Azikiwe Station/K-Leg, 1036-Ganymed.
strTooltip: Ask about illicitly procured visa opportunities for Permanent Resident status at Nnamdi Azikiwe Station/K-Leg, 1036-Ganymed.

strDesc: [us] tells [them] in no uncertain terms that Ayotimiwa has any attempt at gaining legal status on K-Leg locked down tighter than Harbourmaster Adeyemi's private booze collection. This is not the rock for climbers, but you can always try K-Leg embassies on other worlds to buy your way in back here.

strTooltip: Browse illicitly procured visa materials for Permanent Resident status at Encantado Aerostat, Venus.

strDesc:
Cost: $1,000,000

Rumor has it that some local entities are willing, and able, to forge Encantado's Express Entry (3E) work visas for persons with certain skills that can aid them in their criminal operations.

Encantado's main enterprises are racing, gambling, and larceny, so desired skills include:

—Gambling
—Street Etiquette
—Piloting
—Stealth
—Intrusion

The visa will state some legitimate work skill for the Skilled Labor (SL) program, and should hold up to moderate scrutiny at any immigration checkpoint.

Requirements: When you have at least one of these skills and enough cash on hand, you can pursue this option.

After submitting your application fee, your request is transmitted to interested sponsors. A local operative assesses your proficiency in the desired skillsets.

Congratulations! You are now the proud holder of Permanent Resident status on Encantado!

Go enjoy the trade discounts and private housing (with free docking) opportunities.

(Hopefully the forgery holds up!)

strTooltip: Browse illicitly procured visa materials for Permanent Resident status at Newcal Aerostat, Venus.

strDesc:
Cost: $1,000,000

Rumor has it that some local entities are willing, and able, to forge Newcal's Open Arms (OA) work visas for persons with certain skills that can aid them in their criminal operations.

NewCal is dirty with loafing influencers, so desired skills include:

—Oligarch Etiquette
—Persuasion
—Acting
—Cooking
—Dancing
—Hacking

The visa will state some legitimate work skill for the Open Arms (OA) program, and should hold up to moderate scrutiny at any immigration checkpoint.

Requirements: When you have at least one of these skills and enough cash on hand, you can pursue this option.

After submitting your application fee, your request is transmitted to interested sponsors. A local operative assesses your proficiency in the desired skillsets.

Congratulations! You are now the proud holder of Permanent Resident status on Newcal!

Go enjoy the trade discounts and private housing (with free docking) opportunities.

(Hopefully the forgery holds up!)
You resume playing.
The Pacific Airlines Space Service shuttle is arriving...

You step board the shuttle, and scan the room for any available seats to strap into.

It's a smallish vessel, and mostly a mix of folks not looking like they're about to step into the void to spin some wrenches. Indies tend to have their own ship, while day laborers use whatever barge their foreman provides that shift.

So what's left here are those crossing the cold void to see a distant friendly face, or attend an on-site. Or maybe they're on the first leg of a longer voyage. The kind of folk who brought some leftovers to eat en route, or a book on their PDA.

You strap-in to avoid delaying them any longer, and the rapid hissing of RCS signals your departure.
The shuttle arrives at your destination.

You turn away the PASS vessel, and remain where you are.

Pacific Airlines Space Service policy requires passengers to pay the full voyage fare if PASS vessel service is cancelled at point of boarding.

Customers may cancel before vessel arrival for a nominal cancellation fee.

Pacific Airlines Space Service policy prohibits passengers who are recently involved in combat from boarding PASS vessels.

Customers are advised to call again for ferry service when all conflicts have been resolved.
You resume playing.

The clamps on your docking ring engage and your hull resonates like a struck gong. While your sensors scan the vessel for data, you close your eyes and imagine the fortune that could await you on the other side.

Perhaps you've found a racing skiff: a nimble vessel with a lightweight hull pushed around by a top-of-the-line RCS package and a four can Miura "Hydra" Intake Regulator. Or maybe you've stumbled on a multi-cabin pleasure yacht: an elite catamaran complete with a full bar and corridors adorned with yards of crimson and cream Van Hummel interiors.

Or maybe it's just a dead freighter. A decades-old Testudo hauler packed with trash and sporting a giant hole where the reactor used to be. This is a junkyard, after all.

Whatever it is, you've got access to it now, and a bit of time before Ayosec security goons harrass you.

If you're a salvager, maybe you'll smash and grab rare parts to fence back at OKLG? Cut out whatever you can quickly for a buck. Or with a license, trade a bit of profit for less pressure and more resale reliability.

If you're a mechanic, you could fix it up. Make it fly. Derelicts go for a discount at the ship broker, and any sweat equity you put into it after you buy it is yours to keep. You could even resell it when you're done for a tidy profit.

Or, if you're an outlaw, you could always just steal it. Sometimes it can feel pretty good to stay one step ahead of Ayotimiwa's corporate security goons, if you're willing to give up docking it at patrolled ports.

From the outside, the Flotilla looks like an impossible place: a hodgepodge of dead ships welded together at odd angles, entire hulls recognizable and intact, as if a dark star collapsed and sucked half the Boneyard into a single doomed point.

Inside it's a twisting warren of corridors leading to cabins of varying, vague, and ever shifting purpose. Trash and shadows gather in every corner. Figures dart and huddle and lie in heaps. A distinct melange of odors lend the place an air of the tawdry exotic: food, cigarettes, ozone, urine, perfume.

Apparently it all started with a humble salvage pod and a pissed off spacer. Accounts differ as to whether she was dodging criminals or law enforcement or simple docking fees, but in any case, she flew her little Ryokka TU-77a about three thousand clicks outside of 1036 Ganymed, welded it to the side of a reactor-powered Testudo Myna, and parked there for good.

Her tantrum wouldn't have mattered if it weren't for a clever bit of engineering. She managed to hack together a controller for her RCS package that perfectly mimicked the oblong, years-long orbit of Ganymed. Soon after that, a heavy hitter in the criminal underworld caught wind of a spot outside the prying eyes of Ayotimiwa Security, moved his outfit onboard, and the rest is history. Sordid, bloody, vile history.

Now, years on, the Flotilla has ripened into a refuge for criminals, thieves, freedom fighters, the insane. It's become a catch-all for anyone who refuses to hack it in the dead-end labor grind Ayotimiwa sponsors on OKLG station. There are no cops. No docking fees. A scrap trade for hull parts keeps the economy humming, along with a weapons broker, various drug dealers, and the odd humanitarian.

Still, despite all this, there's something to admire about the Flotilla, and the desperate people aboard it. Unlike OKLG, where everyone has their hand in each other's pocket, the spacers here are bound by something stronger than a contract.

The simple fact is that they share needs that can only be met by relying on one another. The need to eat, the need to sleep, the need to breathe. There's a certain pride to living here, an enduring knowledge that despite the fact that you might get stabbed in the liver, at least you won't die wearing an Ayotimiwa t-shirt.
You made it to Newcal aerostat, the de facto capital of Venus! You are immersed in busy cosmopolitan crowds decked in ludicrous levels of branding and sponsorship. Does anyone even work here?

The Los Angeles construction district greets you with rebar, tools, catwalks, and sulfur-tinged haze. LA is the NewCal's newest district awaiting completion and integration into the city aerostat proper.

Of course, as with every corporate project, construction is behind schedule and over budget.

Progress is also hindered by jealous factions from Encantado and Cloudbreak who pay lucratively for illicit deliveries of the new construction tech. They justify the sponsorship of a booming sabatoge trade by claiming the tech was all developed from data stolen from the older aerostats in the first place.

With a discarded construction tech ID and a fritzy wall panel, you manage to override the Los Angeles Construction Zone service dock, granting you future direct ship access via comms uplink.

NewCal PD and Air Navy may not like it, but you can now dock directly for easier access and exfiltration.

The door to K-Leg station slides open and you're greeted by the familiar aroma of station vendor fare: spot prawn stir fry in suya curry, kebab of chicken in a yaji spice rub, Szechuan beef with pink peppercorn. Your head knows that the meat is aquaponic or lab grown or worse, but your heart tells you that anything prepared by human hands is better than Trenchers chow.

Tired looking spacers circulate between the bunks, the refuel kiosk and the breaker yard, moving in and out of the gossamer haze of cigarette smoke that is a permanent fixture on the station. The smokes are Sungara Viceroys, the breaker brand of choice. Folks here will chain-smoke them unfiltered no matter how many times Ayotimiwa execs fine them for overworking the CO2 scrubbers.

Your new ship is waiting in port, not far from the kiosk hub and scrap shops. Once you find it you can finally undock from this rock. If you want to strip ships for salvage, all you need are the hand tools you own. But you'll need a welder to start remodeling and repairing hulls.

Either way, if you're lucky, you can finally start making a living. Something beyond the corporate sponsored ratrace of breaking ships for daily wage. A life you can call your own.

Stepping off the tram at K-Leg's commercial district, the difference is immediately apparent. It's not nicer, but...maybe less worn-out? Like less people come here. Or at least less rough and tumble types.

The main point of interest here is the Port Authority office. A place every captain inevitably becomes familiar with, as they navigate the web of red tape surrounding spaceport operations.

Usually, you'll find at least a few pilots and ship owners slouched in line here, down on their luck, and hoping for a break.

The longer the line, the more likely that the "nice" clerk is on duty today.

strTitle: Ship Broker, Medical Kiosk, and Colony Embassies
strDesc: This district also offers spacers with funds to spare plenty of lavish means to part with their windfalls. The Ship Broker offers mortgages on pre-owned vessels as well as derelicts from the Boneyard stock. The Van Buren Self-Care kiosk offers medical products and treatments for acute and chronic ailments. Embassies for distant colonies allow application for permanent resident visas, coveted for tax discounts and improved legal treatment. Unfortunately, the decade since the loss of Earth to the ablative cascade of '59 has rendered colony interaction increasingly rare and informal, and legal status highly coveted, let alone full citizenship. Legal status often confers local benefits such as cargo trade discounts and rights to purchase private housing and docking.
strTooltip: Learn about Ship Broker, Medical Kiosk, and Colony Embassies

strDesc:
The red neons cast heavy shadows in the Old Emporium, K-Leg's only leisure district. The OE is a relic of a former world, a portal to the halcyon days of the wildcat Nigerian colony before Earth's ablation cascade gutted the economy. Spacers come here to escape the bureaucratic grind, to imagine a world without bosses, to split a chilled bottle of Bismertnaya even when they can't afford to.

A dozen meters away from the shuttle stop you see a knot of revelers gathered in the warm light of the Mescaform bar. Laughter and conversation float through Mescaform in a melange of English, Mandarin, and even Yoruba. That last one might be a sign Ayo managers are mixing it up with the common folk.

Whatever the language, the warm organics of human voices in close proximity is a welcome departure from the hollow echo of comm chatter.

One of the faces in the crowd is The Fixer. They're a known quantity in the station community, K-Leg's portal to a system-wide, ever shifting Black Market whose appetite for used ship parts and other rare salvage can never be sated.

Shouldn't be too hard to get The Fixer talking. Just mention you have something to trade and they're likely to be interested.

Calico City welcomes you, as long as you don't intend to linger.

Ceres persists on a careful diet of mining, independence, and vigilante justice. The population here is ambitious, clamoring, and uneasy.

Perhaps in time, visitors will be welcome to participate in more than simply port and trade activities.

Welcome to the Mint! But don't call it that on-board or you may find yourself inconvenienced by a nicked carotid artery. The CCRE claims the days of piracy are over, but it also absolves itself of responsibility for the manner in which residents or mercs may decide to preserve the station's dignity.

The 'Ring Station' runs on respect, offered and earned, while operating the most lucrative mining processing industry in the System. Belt colonies and corporations send ore, and the Ring Station spins it into gold. The population here is ambitious, clamoring, and uneasy.

Perhaps in time, visitors will be welcome to participate in more than simply port and trade activities.

Welcome to Jade Rabbit! First home of humanity's off-world endeavors, and Xinhua's stepping-stone to space supremacy. Now the crumbling art deco facades conceal a collapsed and possibly haunted tourism bubble that refuses to die.

The squatters who call Jade Rabbit home scrape an economy out of He-3 production, reliving long-past glory days, and specious claims of intermittent communications relayed from Old Earth. The population here is hungry, clamoring, and uneasy.

Perhaps in time, visitors will be welcome to participate in more than simply port and trade activities.

You shouldn't be here. The old world died in 2059, as the Kessler Syndrome lit the sky.

While the ablation cascade wreaked havok on humanity off-world, those remaining on the surface have suffered worse. The population here is ambitious, clamoring, and uneasy. Pragmatic scavengers proclaiming a New Earth Ostracon holds answers about what is lost, and what is to come.

Welcome to Qincheng Station. If you have business with Mercury and Prokofiev Penal Colony, conduct it at Qincheng. If not, be on your way.

Qincheng's existence relies on thriving via stability and maintaining an unruffled status quo, even in the face of scarcity, aging infrastructure, and ever more one-way immigrants bound for the surface. The population here is ambitious, clamoring, and uneasy.

Perhaps in time, visitors will be welcome to participate in more than simply port and trade activities.

Welcome to Atlantis! The submarine colony nestled self-sufficiently under the ice crusts of Europa.

Atlantis supplies the lion's share of the System's water trade, along with research coveted by Voltaire and neutral diplomatic positioning pursued by both the Galilean Confederacy and Titan. The population here is patient and ambitious, plying Europa's mysteriosu, clamoring, and uneasy the oceans.

Perhaps in time, visitors will be welcome to participate in more than simply port and trade activities.

Welcome one and all to Fort Simpson! The capital of the brand new capital of the Galilean Confederacy.

Where other colonies have resources, administrative acumen, and earned diplomatic clout, Fort Simpson thrives in spirit and eager optimism. The population here is eager, clamoring, and uneasy.

Perhaps in time, visitors will be welcome to participate in more than simply port and trade activities.

Welcome to Porto Nuevo Station! The gateway to the Jovian industrial colonies, the many moons and Trojans.

Jupiter originally dominated mineral and gas mining, before the Galilean Confederacy threw the Jovian colonies into revolution against corporate rule. The population here is hard-working, clamoring, and uneasy.

Perhaps in time, visitors will be welcome to participate in more than simply port and trade activities.

Welcome to Hanzhou! Humanities' finest and grandest achievement. Decades in the making. The first and likely the only Earth-like paradise among the stars.

Hanzhou Orbital offers health and leisure available nowhere else in the System, but as to be expected, immigration is therefore formidable and unflinching.

Perhaps in time, visitors will be welcome to participate in more than simply port and trade activities.

Welcome to 'The Lab'. If you're looking for anything good, you're in the wrong place. Formerly the overwhelmed Noctis Regional Processing Facility, now a miserable gathering place of humanity unwelcome elsewhere.

Not much catches the eye here, and much offends it.

Perhaps in time, visitors will be welcome to participate in more than simply port and trade activities.

Welcome to Suzhou! While still impressive, the underfunded Suzhou Orbital will always pale in comparison to the paradise of its sister orbital Hangzhou.

Suzhou Orbital primarily leases acres and acres of its internal surface area to corporations seeking minimal regulation and oversight such as DND Cola, Renbao Smart Technologies, Inc., and Ogiso's Resgister.

Perhaps in time, visitors will be welcome to participate in more than simply port and trade activities.

Tharsis Landing welcomes all. The capital of Xinhua culture and the the most populous center of trade and influence System-wide.

You'll find nearly anything money can buy in Tharsis Landing, as well as everything else that comes along with making such dreams possible.

Perhaps in time, visitors will be welcome to participate in more than simply port and trade activities.

Welcome to Voltaire! Home to Brave New World Corporation's famous Voltaire University and high-tech research facility par excellence.

Voltaire hosts the System's best biomedical labs, and is always seeking science materials (and test subjects) to fuel its production of ever new marvels of modern technology.

Perhaps in time, visitors will be welcome to participate in more than simply port and trade activities.

Welcome to Virginia! The capital and crowning jewel of American space expansion efforts, forever shining in Saturn's breath-taking orbit.

Virginia thrives on military tech and the most sophisticated and vast shipbuilding operation extant in the System after the ablation cascade severed Old Earth. The population here is ambitious, clamoring, and uneasy.

Perhaps in time, visitors will be welcome to participate in more than simply port and trade activities.

Welcome to Cloudbreak aerostat! The smallest Venusian aerostat, the active science station Cloudbreak is rather unremarkable compared with its neighbors.

Cloudbreak's population is minimal, and most residents are studious sorts, collaborating to research and develop new sensor technology while studying Venus' atmosphere, climate, and surface.

It's still Venus, so there are plenty of influencers, documentarists, and drama-mongers waiting for Cloudbreak to have its day. One such possibility is brewing factionalism pitting Cloudbreak and Encantado against the more powerful Newcal.

Cloudbreak welcomes any aerostat construction tech you're willing to sell.

Welcome to Encantado aerostat! The oldest aerostat on the planet, famous for its cloud racing leagues, Grande Prêmio do Encantado, and, of course, gambling. Visit Sol Vermelho Lounge if you want in on the racing action yourself, or if you simply want to be seen among the influencers, celebrities, and System-famous entertainers that tend to gather here.

The aging aerostat is far less impressive than sunny Newcal, but that just means folks here pay handsomely for aerostat tech and salvage nicked from Newcal's construction project, a new Los Angeles district.

Welcome to the Venus Orbital Station! While certainly less culturally and economically significant than the Venusian aerostat colonies, VORB thrives as a trade and refueling hub for spacefaring vessels incapable of either entering Venus' thick and volatile atmosphere, or exiting Venus' gravity well.

During long shifts spent eviscerating half-dead ships in the Boneyard, you often wondered what it would feel like to do the opposite. Why wrench out the beating heart from a wounded ship when you could just nurse it back to health instead?

The question returns to you as you look around this derelict, now through the eyes of a self-employed spacer. The prospect of finding an answer has you feeling like an uncaged animal. The sound of your breathing repeats in your helmet and grows more eager with every exhalation.

You set to work and your tools resound through the hull all around you. During idle moments it's hard not to consider the consequences of installing and uninstalling parts you don't own. Sure, you're in a junkyard. But it's Ayotimiwa's junkyard. And while they might turn a blind eye to the salvage trade when it suits them, they will bring the hammer down as soon as it doesn't.

That goes double if you happen to make a derelict fly. The standard blocks on a Nav Station are onerous, but far from prohibitive. And clever engineering can take you a long way.

But as soon as trash becomes treasure, you can be certain corporation security won't be far behind. And, if you're not careful, possibly a few years in the brig.

Of course, one upside to Ayo being fueled by blood and profit is that they'll sell anything to anyone for the right price. The Магазин Судового Брокера in the OKLG Commercial district keeps a record of every hunk of junk out here. Including this one. So that's where you'd go if you decided to purchase her proper.

Either way, stealing or buying, it won't be cheap. But freedom never is.
[us] views info on [them].
strTooltip: Displays information about registering for and viewing racing leagues

strDesc: This kiosk allows you to join leagues and view standings and results of most recent races. Racers complete each race in a league individually and in order. Times are compared for league standings. To start a race: 1. First join a league from the racing kiosk (paying the entry fee). Races proceed in order for that league. Your available options depend on your demonstrated ability. 2. While in a league, use your Comms options from your Nav Station to hail the race's kiosk station (e.g. VENC) and select "RACING". 3. Select either "Start practice" or "Start race" from the Comms option to begin the league's next race. Practice as much as you like, but each race occurs only once per league. The timer does not begin immediately. 4. Fly to the racing waypoints. Pass the Start gate to start your time. 5. Fly between paired gate markers (i.e. 1A and 1B) to progress in the race. Usually gates must be passed in numeric order, but some tracks differ. Earn points by completing races, and racers with the highest points in a league earn prize money.

PointToPoint A rally track. Go from the Start gate, pass through gates in order and end at the last gate. Circuit A full-circuit lap track. Go from the Start gate, through gates in order and end at the start gate (possibly with more than 1 lap) Orientation A freestyle navigation track. Go from the Start gate through all the gates in any order you wish and end by passing through the start gate.

As comfortable as it feels to return to the station after scouring the cold boneyard for parts, in the world of semi-legal salvage, finding parts is only half the battle. The rest is selling it.

Station centers are connected by rail, a single car shuttle system that is constantly in a state of disrepair. With a working knowledge of the station and an appetite for risk, you might even find a way to make a living on this rock.

The OKLG economy is a strange beast. There's the corporate sponsored salvage trade, run through the scrap and license kiosks. With the right license you can rent time out in the boneyard and pick parts without being bothered by the AyoSec goons.

The black market is another matter. Industrious scavengers know that if you want a premium price for a rare piece, then you're going to have to find a reliable fence. But it won't be easy gaining their trust.

Lastly, the GigNexus shops out jobs to just about anyone. The work ranges from menial station jobs to high-risk boarding operations. In every case, the faster you work, the more money you'll find.

A slight pang of humiliation rushes through you, as the audible buzzer announces your permission is denied. Unpaid docking fees.

"I'm sure it happens all the time," you assure yourself. Surely they won't assume you were trying to skip town without paying?

In any case, you'll need to pay those fees before you're going anywhere. Either click your money total for the Finances ledger, or use one of the ubiquitous orange station kiosks.

That, or find someone at the Port Authority desk who might just let you slide this one time...

Fourth shift ends and the change in the atmosphere is unmistakable. Shipbreakers stop sparking their hand torches. Long-armed construction waldos drop their grip and drift away from wrecked hulls. Two clicks out, a cargo hauler cuts its reactor and the entire rig burns down like a cold ember in the dark.

Untime: the closest anyone out here will ever get to a Sabbath. Twenty minutes and fifty-eight glorious seconds welded to the end of shift four, a seemingly insignificant stretch of time remaining like loose change after the rest of the hours are divided, counted and spent.

In the beginning, Untime was merely a quirk of the New Celestial Calendar, a more even way to divide the year now that Humanity had uncoupled itself from Earth and its overwrought lunar calendar. But that was decades ago. These days, Untime is for rest, for conversation, for anything at all that won't turn a buck for the bosses.

As for the managers who choose not to observe this fine tradition? Two weeks ago one of them "fell" from a labor barge and hit every ship on the way down.
Welcome aboard! Your vessel was successfully towed to its target station. Please standby momentarily, while our docking system is securing your ship

With one last look back at the barracks you've called home all these years, you step through the threshold into your salvage pod. It won't get far on it's own, but you know of at least a few derelicts, out there in the K-Leg boneyard, that might be candidates for your next ship.

Start checking the derelicts out, and choose one to make your own.

With one last look back at the barracks you've called home all these years, you step through the threshold into your salvage pod. It won't get far on it's own, but you know of at least a few derelicts, out there in the K-Leg boneyard, that might be candidates for your next ship.

Start checking the derelicts out, and choose one to make your own.

The call comes through the tinny speakers. "This is Utopia Risk Management," says a bored voice on the other side of the airlock. "We are legally boarding you under section 27-2 of the Ayotimiwa Operational License Agreement. Have one of your crew report to the airlock and stand well back with your personal devices set to I.D. display."

strTitle: The Purple Jumpsuit of The Mariner
strDesc:
People can't stop staring. You walk into a room and the chatter dies down as all eyes are drawn to your body sheathed in radiant periwinkle. It's as if you were The Mariner herself.

It's hard to say where the superstitions about The Mariner and the color purple began. It could be as simple as a last name. Before she was The Mariner, the first person to be murdered in space was Olivia Violet Highsmith. She was by all accounts a cheerful NASA engineer hailing from rural Michigan. It's possible that after her infamous and violent passing, someone clever latched on to that middle name and never let go.

But that doesn't explain what The Mariner is said to look like. It doesn't explain the lavender haze that pumps from the severed O2 tube trailing her body. Nor does it describe the attraction. Mariner Seekers insist, and insist they can prove, that purple increases the likelihood of meeting the ancient specter by tenfold.

Doesn't matter now. The belief has stuck and your lavender jumpsuit proves it. The suit came from a merchandising gimmick sponsored by Damask Rose as part of the marketing campaign for their "Purple Curse" strain. That is, until a series of accidents befell customers wearing them, fueling rumors that Damask had angered the ghost by being so cavalier about her passing.

So what you've got on your hands is a collectors item. Just don't expect anyone to buy you any drinks.

strTitle: Clobbered by a Memory of the Dumbest Thing You've Ever Said
strDesc:
It arrives without warning: a memory from long ago so embarrassing, so superheated by shame, that it feels like molten metal poured down the center of your back. 

Why did you say that? The question haunts you. You could have said anything, quite literally, and instead you said…that. You see their face, their eyes, their pained wince.

Your rational mind assures you that they've forgotten by now. Surely they've lost track of that catastrophically stupid thing you said. But the soul is not rational, and memory is not fair, so here it sits: The Dumbest Thing You've Ever Said, the moment as fresh now, years later, as it has ever been.

Wow. It's going to take a couple hours to shake that one off.

strTitle: Clobbered by a Memory of a Love Now Lost
strDesc:
You find yourself mulling over their memory again, stretching it out like an aching muscle, returning to a pain you've grown fond of because it is, at the very least, familiar.

It was one of your shortest relationships. Perhaps for that very reason it is the one that endures, the one you miss in the quiet moments.

It's the sense memories that remain, mostly. The sound of their laugh. The softness of their forearm felt beneath your thumb. The scent of them between the ear and the nape of the neck.

It's better to have loved and lost, they say. And in moments like this, when you're adrift and otherwise alone in the cold eternity of space, you believe it to be true.

They haul you before an AyoSec magistrate for judgement, leaving your ship and gear behind.

At the hearing, you can beg for just a fine- $15,000 payable in full or installments- or it's off to Azikiwe Brig for a year or three of hard labor.

It's almost like they want you to break the rules so they can extract more fines from you.

You sign reams of paperwork in tight cuffs.

It's a prison sentence of another sort. Another weight hanging around your neck.

New $15,000 fine added.

strTitle: Plead for a fine (Paid in installments)
strDesc:
It's almost like they want you to break the rules so they can lock you deeper in interest payments.

You sign reams of paperwork in tight cuffs.

It's a prison sentence of another sort. Another weight hanging around your neck.

New $15,000 debt added, with payment due each shift.

After processing, you are unceremoniously dumped outside the OKLG Security Office. If you weren't docked at station when you were arrested, you may need to use the PASS ferry service (on your PDA) to reach your ship again. Hopefully it's still there.

Time to get back on your feet.
You are hauled off to Azikiwe Brig.

You spend months laboring without wage among outcasts both meek and dangerous. You share a dorm with nearly a hundred other souls, all of you stacked like kindling on triple high bunks.

But even a hell like this is not without opportunity. You hear things. You meet people. You get in a few scrapes, you find a few friends. By the end of your term you've lived a dozen lives and you have all the scars to prove it.

Plus, free room and board. In a certain light, it might all be worth it...

After processing, you are unceremoniously dumped outside the OKLG Security Office. If you weren't docked at station when you were arrested, you may need to use the PASS ferry service (on your PDA) to reach your ship again. Hopefully it's still there.

Time to get back on your feet.

They haul you before a magistrate for judgement, leaving your ship and gear behind.

At the hearing, you can beg for just a fine- $15,000 payable in full or installments- or it's off to NewCal Brig for a year or three of hard labor.

It's almost like they want you to break the rules so they can extract more fines from you.

You sign reams of paperwork in tight cuffs.

It's a prison sentence of another sort. Another weight hanging around your neck.

New $15,000 fine added.

strTitle: Plead for a fine (Paid in installments)
strDesc:
It's almost like they want you to break the rules so they can lock you deeper in interest payments.

You sign reams of paperwork in tight cuffs.

It's a prison sentence of another sort. Another weight hanging around your neck.

New $15,000 debt added, with payment due each shift.

After all your work cracking the Camellia Middlemist case, you and the DA might as well be close personal friends. That is made very clear during the pre-trial hearing, when a Very Important Somebody approaches the magistrate during your plea.

 You're let off the hook without another word. Nothing better than having friends in high places.

After processing, you are unceremoniously dumped outside the Venusian Security Office. If you weren't docked at station when you were arrested, you may need to use the PASS ferry service (on your PDA) to reach your ship again. Hopefully it's still there.

Time to get back on your feet.

After processing, you are escorted outside the NCPD Security Office. If you weren't docked at station when you were arrested, you may need to use the PASS ferry service (on your PDA) to reach your ship again. Hopefully it's still there.

Time to get back on your feet.
You are hauled off to NewCal Brig.

You spend months laboring without wage among outcasts both meek and dangerous. You share a dorm with nearly a hundred other souls, all of you stacked like kindling on triple high bunks.

But even a hell like this is not without opportunity. You hear things. You meet people. You get in a few scrapes, you find a few friends. By the end of your term you've lived a dozen lives and you have all the scars to prove it.

Plus, free room and board. In a certain light, it might all be worth it...

After processing, you are unceremoniously dumped outside the NewCal Security Office. If you weren't docked at station when you were arrested, you may need to use the PASS ferry service (on your PDA) to reach your ship again. Hopefully it's still there.

Time to get back on your feet.

strTooltip: Pay for first aid or treatments that can remove chronic ailments.

strDesc:
You know this is more like a placebo or bandaid compared to the state-of-the-art treatments rich folks enjoy on Hangzhou or Mars.

It's painful, probably not sterile, and beyond the budgets of most K-Leg residents, but it's the only option around for helping your space-wracked body a little less of a mess.

Cost: $2,500

Treat injuries with a nanorobotic injection that stimulates wound healing and immune response to infection and some diseases for a handful of hours.

(Only options you can afford are available)
You sign away your right to protest both the exorbitant prices and any potential side effects, then grit your teeth and suffer through the necessary procedures.

Cost: $250,000

You don't have to know how they do it, you just transfer the payment and hope for an easier tomorrow.

What work would you have done?

(Only options you can currently afford are available)
You sign away your right to protest both the exorbitant prices and any potential side effects, then grit your teeth and suffer through the necessary procedures.

You resume playing.

You're at their mercy, and they are not gentle. They loot your pockets and admire your former valuables.

That annoying part of your mind asserts it could be worse. At least they didn't bother taking your ship, dumping you in the void, or both.

What's left, and what happens next?
You resume playing.
